department.dept_long_name: Division of Engineering and Applied Sciences

course.title: Series Expansions and Complex Analysis
course.description: Introduces fundamental concepts for solving real-world problems and emphasizes their applications through examples from the physical and social sciences. Topics: series expansions and their convergence; complex functions, mappings, differentiation, integration, residues, Taylor and McLaurin expansions; wave (Fourier) and wavelet expansions and transformations, and their uses in signal and image analysis and solving differential equations.
course.prerequisites: Applied Mathematics 21a and 21b, or Mathematics 21a and 21b.
